pull.title: Cleanup: Replace "URL" with "URI" where we aren't actually working with URLs

events.body: You really need to stop calling things bugfixes that arent ;).  This is a code cleanliness change, no functional or user-visible changes are made.
I consider it a bug to say "apple" when it refers to a grapefruit :p
I dont if its not user-facing and doesnt affect functionality.
Rebased, this should probably go into 0.6.1.

NACK,

I think while we are working on the URI handling and the IPC stuff, there should be no cosmetic changes to the code, that only renames stuff. After the main work is finished I'm fine with a rename to URI, but that's for sure a core dev vote :).

events.message: Bugfix: Replace "URL" with "URI" where we aren't actually working with URLs

events.body: Since we don't have any merge ready IPC fixes, I'm inclined to take this largely cosmetic fix now— we are in cleanup mode afterall, Sorry Diapolo.
No prob, as long as I'm allowed to say what I think ;).
